title: illaoi Does Not Feel Like A Jagernaut.
body:
The healing from her tentacles is barely noticeable,and she does not have any other defensive ability or passive in her kit.
Her tentacles die too fast when shes out of lane or laning against ranged champions and her lack of mobility causes her to get caught easily if she doesnt build defensive items.
All in all i think illaoi's design is flawd picking her feels like  a bad bet since there are a ton of champions with fewer weaknesses and more strenghts than her.Her Lack of mobility is not compensated with any defensive stats and her  reliability on her tentacles makes her weaker out of lane.
If one decides to build her full ad,you could have just picked {{champion:126}} more mobility,more poke,safer pick.
if one decides to build her with defensive items{{champion:122}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:86}} even {{champion:114}} have better defensive/healing abilities.
I am just expressing my opinion in this post so refrain from posting hate comments.

replies.body: maybe, but show different examples though, using a bunch a duelist as examples (cept darius/mundo) then again i don't think mundo counts as a juggernaut... since illaoi is basically a teamfighter

illaoi is good in teamfights thats true but she does not have any form of engage ,it has happened to me a milion times,maokai/leona lands the 5 man ult and im just not close enough as illaoi to do my thing.

in her defense, most juggernauts don't have a form of engage, even darius has a very small aoe cone that can be easily avoided, the fact she has any form of getting to the fight with her W is amazing as it is... but yea, that's normally the biggest jaugger problem

With healing masteries, spirit visage, and potentially death's dance, her healing can keep her alive indefinitely through a fight. Executioners calling messes her up, but she's not the Juggernaut who's impacted the most by it, and most every Juggernaut can be crippled by executioners. 

Her mobility is fine for a Juggernaut, as others might have strong movespeed buffs, her strength is that she's easily the strongest area controlling Juggernaut. Juggernauts like Garen might get a fight going by running in, while Illoai does it by slowly but surely moving a zone of death forward towards the enemy. 

Her reliability on tentacles is the trade off for her monstrous ult, which she can use to single handily win teamfights if played right. 

While she lacks CC, I would argue that her form of CC (her E) is amongst the best of the Juggernauts CC. Fairly good range, strong way to harass or even make someone leave lane for a bit of time, and applies a good slow. Other Juggernauts have even less effective CC, which is fine as the class in general isn't supposed to have top tier CC.

JAGERNAUT. 

I desperately need a nautilus skin with Jagermeister bottles attached to his breathing apparatus.
